meanings.definition: The reversible transformation of a chemical species between two forms with different absorption spectra induced by light.
meanings.sent1: Photochromism allows the substance to change color when light hits it.
meanings.sent2: The photochromism of the material makes it perfect for sunglasses that darken in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The photochromism of the paint made the room look like a rainbow when the sun shone through the window.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like photochromism, shifting from bright to dark depending on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The photochromism of the flowers in the garden was like magic, as they bloomed in different colors under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The property of certain substances to change color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: When the curtains were drawn back, the photochromism of the fabric revealed a hidden pattern.
meanings.sent2: The photochromism of the dye in the shirt made it turn a vibrant hue under the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photochromism of the chameleon was so extreme that it blended perfectly with any background.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a photochromism quality, appearing to change color depending on the lighting.
meanings.sent5: The photochromism of the sky at sunset painted the clouds in a beautiful array of colors.
